newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica stocks mixed in record volume,NBS features.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica stocks mixed in record volume,NBS features.

text.p: South African shares ended strong on Tuesday with volumes at a record high boosted by a massive trade in NBS Holdings Ltd during the afternoon, dealers said.

Industrial shares had been languishing in negative to flat for much of the day until it received a shot in the arm from the release of U.S. first quarter employment and March durable goods data -- both which showed tame inflationary prospects.
The banking an financial sector also saw good trade with the financial index ending up 103.6 points at a fresh record high of 8,905.8 points.
Gold shares were sickly, depressed by a weak bullion price which has lost $3 since Friday.
The industrial index ended up 45.4 points to 8,451.4 and the all-share index added 34.4 points to 7,106.4 points.
The gold index ended down 29.8 points at another fresh low of 1,205.2 points -- its lowest level since April 1993.
